description: Kummer numbers: -1 + product of first n consecutive primes.
comments: a(n) is congruent to -1 modulo the first n primes. - _Michael Engling_, Mar 31 2011
references: E. E. Kummer, Neuer elementarer Beweis des Satzes, dass die Anzahl aller Primzahlen eine unendliche ist, Monatsber. Preuss.  Akad.  Wiss., Berlin 1878/9, pp. 777-778. [Collected Papers, II, pp. 669-670, Springer, Berlin-Heidelberg, 1975.] Cited in Mestrovic.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100

R. Mestrovic, Euclid's theorem on the infinitude of primes: a historical survey of its proofs (300 BC--2012) and another new proof, arXiv preprint arXiv:1202.3670 [math.HO], 2012 - From N. J. A. Sloane, Jun 13 2012
Hisanori Mishima, Factorizations of many number sequences
R. G. Wilson v, Explicit factorizations
mathematica: Table[Product[Prime[k], {k, 1, n}] - 1, {n, 1, 18}] (* _Artur Jasinski_, Jan 01 2007 *)FoldList[Times,1,Prime[Range[20]]]-1  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 17 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a057588 = (subtract 1) . product . (flip take a000040_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 27 2013(PARI) a(n) = prod(k=1, n, prime(k)) - 1; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 02 2015
author: Mario Velucchi (mathchess(AT)velucchi.it), Oct 05 2000
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Oct 05 2000
